subject: FIN
name: Beginning Finnish I
info: Emphasis on working toward novice-intermediate low proficiency in all four language modalities (listening, reading, speaking, writing). Topics include every day subjects (shopping, directions, family, food, housing, etc.).

subject: FIN
name: Beginning Finnish II
info: Continues the presentation of all four language modalities (listening, reading, speaking, writing) with a proficiency emphasis. Topics include free-time activities, careers, and  the Finnish culture.prereq: 1001

subject: FIN
name: Intermediate Finnish I
info: Emphasis on intermediate proficiency in listening, reading, speaking, and writing. Contextualized work on grammar and vocabulary is combined with authentic readings and essay assignments.prereq: 1002

subject: FIN
name: Intermediate Finnish II
info: Emphasis on developing intermediate mid-high proficiency in listening, reading, speaking, and writing. Contextualized work on grammar and vocabulary is supported by work with authentic readings and essay assignments.prereq: 1003

subject: FIN
name: Advanced Finnish
info: Designed to help students achieve advanced proficiency in Finnish. Discussion of fiction, film, journalistic, and professional prose is complemented by grammar, vocabulary building exercises, and review of oral/written modes of communication.prereq: 1004 or 4004

subject: FIN
name: Advanced Finnish
info: Discussion of novels, short stories, plays, articles. Structural, stylistic, vocabulary-building exercises.prereq: 3011 or 4011

subject: FIN
name: Topics in Finnish Studies
info: Interdisciplinary social science topics on Finnish people, culture, and society. In English.

subject: FIN
name: Beg Finnish Grad Research I
fullname: Beginning Finnish for Graduate Research I
info: Emphasis on working toward novice-intermediate low proficiency in all four language modalities (listening, reading, speaking, writing). Topics include every day subjects (shopping, directions, family, food, housing, etc.). Meets concurrently with 1001.

subject: FIN
name: Beg Finnish Grad Research II
fullname: Beginning Finnish for Graduate Research II
info: Continues the presentation of all four language modalities (listening, reading, speaking, writing) with a proficiency emphasis. Topics include free-time activities, careers, and the Finnish culture. Meets concurrently with 1002.

subject: FIN
name: Int Finnish Grad Research I
fullname: Intermediate Finnish for Graduate Research I
info: Emphasis on intermediate proficiency in listening, reading, speaking, and writing. Contextualized work on grammar and vocabulary is combined with authentic readings and essay assignments. Meets concurrently with 1003.

subject: FIN
name: Int Finnish Grad Research II
fullname: Intermediate Finnish for Graduate Research II
info: Emphasis on developing intermediate mid-high proficiency in listening, reading, speaking, and writing. Contextualized work on grammar and vocabulary is supported by work with authentic readings and essay assignments. Meets with 1004.

subject: FIN
name: Advanced Finnish Grad Research
info: Designed to help students achieve advanced proficiency in Finnish. Discussion of fiction, film, journalistic, and professional prose is complemented by grammar, vocabulary building exercises, and review of oral/written modes of communication. Meets with 3011.

subject: FIN
name: Advanced Finnish Grad Research
info: Discussion of novels, short stories, plays, articles. Structural, stylistic, vocabulary-building exercises. Meets with 3012.

subject: FIN
name: Topics in Finnish Studies
info: Interdisciplinary social science topics on Finnish people, culture, and society. Taught in English.
